intro: Saurauia andreana, commonly known as the Andean mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of trees such as oaks and maples. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Saurauia andreana plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by interacting with host trees and providing food for wildlife.
